Texto: 
left seventh cranial nerve palsy
supportive
• lesion left inferior cerebellar peduncle:
» high signal on t2
» high signal on flair
» enhances with contrast
• focal enhancement lateral aspect left internal auditory canal
ramsay hunt syndrome
• bell's palsy or other inflammatory neuritis
• vestibular (8) or facial (7) schwannoma
• brainstem infarct
• mw

additional findings include sphenoid sinus fluid and bilateral mastoid fluid.
45 year old man presents with painful rash left ear and left seventh cranial nerve palsy
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmedhealth/pmh0002613/
